meanings.definition: In a manner showing spite or malice
meanings.sent1: She spoke despitefully of her rival, revealing her true feelings.
meanings.sent2: He acted despitefully towards his classmates, causing unnecessary conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the dog despitefully, as if challenging it to a staring contest.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered despitefully, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The old witch cackled despitefully as she cast a curse on the village.

meanings.definition: With the intention to harm or offend
meanings.sent1: He spread rumors despitefully, hoping to ruin her reputation.
meanings.sent2: The bully glared at him despitefully, planning his next mean prank.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel chattered despitefully at the birds stealing its nuts.
meanings.sent4: The dark thoughts swirled in his mind despitefully, urging him to seek revenge.
meanings.sent5: The villain grinned despitefully as his evil plan unfolded before him.
